Journal.Title: International journal of environmental research and public health
Journal.ISOAbbreviation: Int J Environ Res Public Health

Article.ArticleTitle: Comparative Analysis of Long-Term Variation Characteristics of SO<sub>2</sub>, NO<sub>2</sub>, and O<sub>3</sub> in the Ecological and Economic Zones of the Western Sichuan Plateau, Southwest China.

AbstractText: Sulfur dioxide (SO<sub>2</sub>), nitrogen dioxide (NO<sub>2</sub>), and ozone (O<sub>3</sub>) are important atmospheric pollutants that affect air quality. The long-term variations of SO<sub>2</sub> and NO<sub>2</sub> in 2008-2018 and O<sub>3</sub> in 2015-2018 in the relatively less populated ecological and economic zones of Western Sichuan Plateau, Southwest China were analyzed. In 2008-2018, the variations in SO<sub>2</sub> and NO<sub>2</sub> in the ecological zone were not significant, but Ganzi showed a slight upward trend. SO<sub>2</sub> decreased significantly in the economic zone, especially in Panzhihua, where NO<sub>2</sub> changes were not obvious. From 2015 to 2018, the concentration of O<sub>3</sub> in the ecological zone increased significantly, while the economic zone showed a downward trend. The rising trend of the concentration ratio of SO<sub>2</sub> to NO<sub>2</sub> in the ecological zone and the declining trend in the economic zone indicate that the energy consumption structure of these two zones is quite different. The lower correlation coefficients between NO<sub>2</sub> and O<sub>3</sub> in the Western Sichuan Plateau imply that the variations of O<sub>3</sub> are mainly affected by the regional background. The effects of meteorological factors on SO<sub>2</sub>, NO<sub>2</sub>, and O<sub>3</sub> were more obvious in the economic zone where there are high anthropometric emissions.
